alert.note: Alert for Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Henry County through 1015 AM EDT... At 959 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mcclure, or 9 miles east of Napoleon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Henry County, including the following locations... Texas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
